dialogue.htmlContent:
[pc.speech(Yes, I'd like to see Lyssieth now,)] you say to Elizabeth.

[elizabeth.speech(Very well, if you'll please follow me,)] she replies, opening the small wicket set into the fortress's huge wooden gates, before stepping through the doorway into Lyssieth's palace. Doing as you're instructed, you follow in Elizabeth's footsteps, and just a moment later, find yourself standing inside a staggeringly-opulent entrance hall.

Gazing at the huge, high-vaulted chamber in wonder, you take note of the fact that the interior of this palace is in complete contrast to the oppressive, inhospitable appearance of the cavern's dark stone walls. The floor beneath your feet is a perfectly polished expanse of clean white marble, and is adorned with a luxuriant red runner carpet which stretches off down the three corridors that are linked to each side of the hall. The walls are covered in white, wooden panelling; their decorative, intricately-carved features are painted in bright gold. Gigantic portraits of regal-looking demons and humans hang on the walls, and up above, the high ceiling is lavishly decorated in the same white-and-gold style as the rest of your surroundings.

As Elizabeth beckons you forwards, you take note of the fact that there are a couple of half-demon and human maids standing to attention on opposite sides of the hall. As you start to follow Elizabeth further into the palace, you wonder how many staff are needed to maintain and clean all of the marble statues, ornate seats, and glass-fronted display cabinets that line the walls of the palace's corridors.

Stepping forwards to walk in parallel with Elizabeth, you gaze in wonder at your extravagant surroundings as the two of you proceed down the corridor that leads directly forwards from the palace's front gate.

[elizabeth.speech(It's not much further to go,)] Elizabeth says, [elizabeth.speech(just to the end of this corridor.)]

Letting out a quick response in acknowledgement of the information given to you, you continue looking around at the ornate statues, paintings, and display cabinets all around you. There seem to be quite a large number of the latter of these, and, while a lot of them are filled with china and other miscellaneous decorative articles, there are many which are filled with ancient-looking antiques.

[pc.speech(Hey, I recognise those,)] you mutter, breaking off from Elizabeth to step over towards one of the display cabinets. You're certain that the collection of ancient, broken pottery is the exact same as a display you remember seeing in Lily's museum, and you turn back towards your half-demon guide as you ask, [pc.speech(Where did Lyssieth get all these relics from?)]

[elizabeth.speech(Please, [pc.name], I'm a member of the royal guard, not a tour guide. I have no knowledge of mundane business such as that. Now, please, if we can just continue,)] Elizabeth replies, trying to suppress the annoyed tone in her voice.

Not satisfied by her answer, you turn to one of the human maids standing nearby, and repeat your question. Smiling, she performs a respectful curtsy, and says, [genericFemale.speech([pc.Sir], I believe that the articles to which you're referring are from Her Highness's personal collection of antiques. I apologise for knowing nothing more than that.)]

[elizabeth.speech(Now, if we could please continue?)] Elizabeth asks.

You do as instructed, but no sooner have you moved on past the next cabinet, do you suddenly spot something even more alarming. Right there, being displayed as though they're precious artefacts, are numerous bottles of fizzy drinks, bars of chocolate, and other assorted snacks. There's absolutely no doubt that these have all come from your old world, and you find yourself shaking your head in disbelief at the fact that Lyssieth is treating common junk food as though they're precious treasures.

You know that neither Elizabeth nor the maids will know anything about them, so you simply continue following the captain of the royal guard as she carries on leading you forwards.

[elizabeth.speech(I can tell that you're impressed by Her Highness's collections. Perhaps you can ask her more about them in a moment,)] Elizabeth says, turning to face you as the two of you reach the end of the corridor. Before you are a pair of large, ornately-carved wooden doors, and you assume that Lyssieth is within the room beyond.

[pc.speech(Yeah, I suppose it would be interesting to find out which vending machine she must have looted,)] you reply.

[elizabeth.speech(I hope you're not insinuating that Her Highness has stolen anything,)] Elizabeth says in an icy tone. [elizabeth.speech(Unfortunately, I need to return to my post as soon as I show you through these doors, so I can't stop you from saying something you'll regret. Just remember who it is you're being given the honour of meeting, and treat Her Highness with the utmost respect. Understand?)]

[pc.speech(I understand,)] you say.

[elizabeth.speech(Good. Now, there's something you need to know,)] Elizabeth continues, blushing a little as she awkwardly tries to explain, [elizabeth.speech(Her Highness, well, she likes to... That is, she respects humans a lot, and, erm... Well, she likes to take on the form of a human. You are absolutely not to judge her on that, nor are you to judge the manner in which she derives entertainment!)]

[pc.speech(Ok, I'm not judging,)] you reply, [pc.speech(but what do you mean, 'entertainment'?)]

Elizabeth flinches as you ask this, before replying [elizabeth.speech(Well, Her Highness likes to act out a certain fantasy, in which she's, erm... what did she call it... a 'chief executive officer'?)]

[pc.speech(Wait, what? You mean she's role-playing as a businesswoman?)]

[elizabeth.speech(Look, I don't question it, alright? Now, do you want to meet with her or not?!)] Elizabeth quickly blurts out, clearly flustered by having to explain Lyssieth's eccentricities to you.

[pc.speech(Of course,)] you reply, breathing a sigh of relief as Elizabeth quickly steps over towards the doors in front of you. Knocking on them three times in quick succession, she opens them and steps inside, beckoning you to follow her.

Following Elizabeth through the doors, you find yourself entering a room quite unlike the sort that you were expecting. Not only is Lyssieth conspicuously absent, but this area appears to be a sort of waiting room, of the same style as you might expect to see in a very prestigious office building.

Instead of white marble, the flooring is dark, polished wood, and slightly off-centre, a large, cream-coloured rug is surrounded on three sides by low-backed black sofas. The cream-painted walls are home to numerous pieces of colourful, abstract art, and on the opposite side from which you entered, there's a single, mahogany door. In each corner of the room, there's a lush, potted plant, and, finally, a low coffee table sits in front of the sofas, and you see that there are several fashion magazines scattered across its surface.

Most surprisingly of all, on the opposite side of the room to the sofas, there sits a sleek, modern-looking desk. Your eyes open wide as you see that the smartly-dressed secretary sitting behind it is none other than [siren.name] herself. While her witch's outfit has been replaced by a black pencil skirt, light-pink shirt, and black blazer, she's still wearing her white eyepatch. As she catches sight of you, she jumps to her feet #IF siren.getAffection(pc)<-90 #THEN and snarls, [siren.speech(At last, we meet again, my arch-nemesis! I may not have my usual attire or weaponry, but, as you're soon to find out, my power is unmatched! Now I shall obliterate y-)] #ELSE #IF siren.getAffection(pc)<0 #THEN and laughs, [siren.speech(At last, we meet again, my arch-nemesis! You should be thankful that we are within my mother's domain, for if it were otherwise, I would surely obliterate y-)] #ELSE and laughs, [siren.speech(My arch-nemesis! Y-You may have saved me before, but I am still your sworn foe! Now, behold my power! I shall obliterate y-)] #ENDIF #ENDIF

[elizabeth.speech(My Lady, please,)] Elizabeth interrupts, referring to her sister by her royal title in acknowledgement that she is a recognised daughter of Lyssieth, while she is not, [elizabeth.speech([pc.name] is an expected guest of Her Highness, and as such, is under our protection.)]

Clearly annoyed by this revelation, [siren.name] crosses her arms, and, pouting, collapses back down into her swivel-chair. [siren.speech(~Hrmph!~ Well, if that is the case, then I shall do my best to contain my world-shattering powers for as long as I can. B-But just know that I could destroy the two of you with a mere snap of my fingers!)]

[elizabeth.speech(Of course, My Lady,)] Elizabeth says, bowing and taking a step back. [elizabeth.speech(I will leave [pc.name] in your care. Please allow [pc.herHim] through to see Lyssieth as soon as possible.)]

[siren.speech(Yes, yes, don't worry Lizzy, I will spare [pc.herHim] from my wrath. You can get back to your work,)] [siren.name] dismissively replies, allowing Elizabeth to turn and make her exit. As the doors close behind her, [siren.name] looks over at you, and, standing up from behind her desk, she lets out a maniacal laugh, [siren.speech(Mwhahaha! Now there's nothing to stop us from settling our feud! Deceit and trickery are tools that I never hesitate to use, and now that Lizzy is out of our way, you should prepare to meet your doom, my arch-nemesis! Now, I shall surely destroy y-)]

At that moment, [siren.name] is interrupted once again, as an arcane-powered intercom sitting on her desk suddenly crackles into life, [lyssieth.speech(What on earth is all of that commotion, [siren.name]? If I have to come out there and remind you of your duties, you're going to be in serious trouble, young lady!)]

Instantly, [siren.name] leans down over the desk, and replies into the speaker, [siren.speech(S-Sorry, mother! I was just, erm, w-well, anyway, I was just about to inform you that your guest has arrived.)]

[lyssieth.speech(Very well, show [pc.herHim] in,)] Lyssieth replies.

[siren.speech(Yes, mother,)] [siren.name] responds, before addressing you as she walks over to the mahogany door, [siren.speech(Right this way, [pc.name], and don't even think of telling on me, ok?!)]

Giving the door a quick knock, [siren.name] opens it and steps forwards into the room beyond. Following in her footsteps, you proceed inside, and finally find yourself entering Lyssieth's office.

Just like the waiting room behind you, the floor is covered in dark, wooden boards, which are mostly concealed by a large, cream-coloured rug. The walls are covered in dark wooden panelling, and set into them are numerous book-filled shelves and ornately carved cabinets. In the very middle of the room, there sits a huge, mahogany desk, and on the side nearest to you, there are two empty seats. On the far side, standing beside a very expensive-looking leather chair, is Lyssieth.

As Elizabeth said, the elder lilin has taken on the form of a human, and appears as a stunningly-beautiful, olive-skinned woman, who looks to be in her mid-forties. Her huge, [lyssieth.cupSize]-cup breasts threaten to spill out of her blouse's plunging neckline at any moment, and, looking down, you see that her long, perfect legs are being well shown-off by her long, black, asymmetrical skirt. Tucking a loose strand of her wavy, dark-brown hair behind one ear, the elder lilin pushes her stylish half-rim glasses up onto the bridge of her nose, before glaring at her daughter and scolding her, [lyssieth.speech(If I've told you once, I've told you a thousand times, young lady, take that ridiculous eye-patch off!)]

[siren.speech(M-Mom,)] [siren.name] stutters, [siren.speech(it seals my dark powers away! If I take it off, then the whole universe could be destroyed!)]

[lyssieth.speech([siren.Name]! You're embarrassing me in front of our guest! Now, not another word from you!)] Lyssieth says, before finally turning to face you, [lyssieth.speech(I do apologise on behalf of my troublesome daughter, and thank you so much for bringing her back to m-)]

As Lyssieth's gaze comes to rest on your face, her eyes suddenly open wide, and you see the hand that's placed on the back of her chair suddenly clench tightly into the leather padding. Her calm, friendly voice completely changes to take on a deep, spine-chilling tone, and as she speaks, the ground beneath your feet almost seems to tremble, [lyssieth.speech(It's you?! You're the one who's been living with my dear Lilaya?!)]

Before you can react, the elder lilin glances behind you, and you jump a little as you hear the heavy mahogany door suddenly slam shut and lock. Fixing her gaze back onto your face, Lyssieth lets out a wild, blood-curdling laugh, before revealing that she knows exactly who you are, [lyssieth.speech(You're the one from the museum! However unwittingly, it was you who finally freed my sisters, my mother, and I from that wretched mirror! After searching for you for the past three years, you turn out to be the one who recently moved in with my precious Lilaya, and now here you are, coming to me of your own free will! Ha... Hahaha!)]

[siren.speech(M-Mom?)] [siren.name] asks, the nervousness in her voice telling you that she's just as worried by Lyssieth's behaviour as you are. [siren.speech(W-What's going on?)]

Ignoring her daughter, Lyssieth continues monologuing, [lyssieth.speech(After all this time, you're finally in my grasp! All I'd have to do is deliver you to mother, and, having proved my loyalty, I'd finally have my freedom returned to me! How easy it would be... To crush you right now...)]

As she was speaking, Lyssieth's beautiful, green eyes were slowly turning bright red, and as she comes to the end of her musings, they suddenly start glowing with a fierce, fire-like intensity. With a loud tearing, snapping noise, her grip proves too much for the poor leather chair to handle, and the back splits clean in two. Being absolutely certain that this frightful elder lilin is about to launch into an attack, you prepare to defend yourself!

You weren't expecting Lilaya's mother to give you such a hostile welcome, and, quickly dropping down into a defensive posture, you prepare to defend yourself against her incoming attack. Instead of taking any offensive action, however, Lyssieth simply laughs, and asks, [lyssieth.speech(Do you really think you stand a chance against me?! It would be but a trifle to force you to submit, and then all I'd have to do is teleport the two of us into mother's throne room, present you to her as a gift, and I'd be free!)]

[pc.speech(I didn't come here to fight,)] you say, [pc.speech(let's not do anything hasty.)]

[lyssieth.speech(You actually think you'd be able to fight back, don't you?)] Lyssieth asks, laughing once again, [lyssieth.speech(Silly [pc.race], all I'd have to do is tell you to [style.glowArcane(kneel)]!)]

The elder lilin's command seems to be infused with a powerful arcane spell, and as the word 'kneel' echoes around the office, you feel a powerful physical force beginning to push you down towards the floor. Simultaneously, a strange haziness settles over your mind, and you start to feel as though it would be the right thing to do to obey Lyssieth...

Refusing to submit, you try to shake your head clear of the intrusive thoughts, and at the same time, you put all of your strength into resisting the crushing downwards force. From what little awareness you have left of your surroundings, you're able to make out a highly-amused smile on Lyssieth's face, and, as she steps towards you, she tuts, [lyssieth.speech(Now, now, that won't do at all. When I give people an order, they're expected to [style.glowArcane(obey)].)]

The physical force pushing down on you suddenly increases in strength, and, try as you might, it's far too powerful for you to resist. As you're finally forced down onto your knees before the elder lilin, your head starts to swim, and you feel as though you're dipping in and out of conciousness. The only words that you can seem to form in your mind are 'yes' and 'mistress', but, still refusing to capitulate, you decide to stay silent instead of using your now severely-limited vocabulary.

Accepting your fate, you give in to the voices of submission in your mind, and allow yourself to be pushed down onto your knees before Lyssieth. Looking up at the elder lilin, you see a highly-amused smile on her face, and, as she steps towards you, she laughs, [lyssieth.speech(Very good. If I were to tell you to surrender yourself to Lilith, allow her to drain your arcane power, and then live out the rest of your life as her slave, would you [style.glowArcane(obey)]?)]

As yet another forceful command is uttered, your head starts to swim, and you feel as though you're dipping in and out of conciousness. The only words that you can seem to form in your mind are 'yes' and 'mistress', and, wanting to do as you're told, you speak them out loud, [pc.speech(Yes, Mistress...)]

#IF siren.getAffection(pc)>30 #THEN [siren.speech(Mom! Stop it! [pc.Name] saved me, remember?!)] [siren.name] shouts, coming to your defence. [siren.speech(Let [pc.herHim] go!)] #ELSE [siren.speech(Mom! What's going on?!)] [siren.name] shouts, clearly distressed by the scene that's taking place in front of her. [siren.speech(This is too much!)] #ENDIF

[lyssieth.speech(Be quiet, [siren.name]! I... I have to!)] Lyssieth snaps, but, as your mind slowly starts to clear, you realise that she doesn't sound too sure of herself. [lyssieth.speech(I... I can't betray mother... I... But... All those people... No! If she were to discover my betrayal, I... I... But I couldn't...)]

Lyssieth suddenly turns away and paces back towards her desk, and as she turns her back on you, the haziness in your mind instantly clears. The physical force that was pushing down on you also immediately vanishes, but, having just borne the brunt of an elder lilin's power, you decide against making any sudden move, and stay down on your knees as you and [siren.name] witness Lyssieth's internal struggle.

[lyssieth.speech(Why don't I just do it?!)] she shouts to herself. You're relieved to hear that her deep, malevolent voice has shifted back to the soft, womanly one which she used to greet you. Pacing back and forth beside her desk, she throws you the occasional glance as she continues in an exasperated tone, [lyssieth.speech(I'd be a fool to go against her! I should just hand you over and be done with it! But... But then she'd regain her full power... And the humans... They'd suffer... No. I can't let that happen!)]

With a final, defeated sigh, she looks down at her ruined chair, and lets out a very sad chuckle, [lyssieth.speech(Now look what I've done...)]

[siren.speech(Mom? Are you ok?)] [siren.name] asks in a quivering voice, and you glance over to see that she looks to be on the verge of tears.

[lyssieth.speech(Yes, I'm sorry, my darling,)] Lyssieth sighs, smiling at her daughter, before looking back down at you. You see that the colour of her eyes has shifted back to a calm green, and, once again tucking a loose strand of her wavy dark-brown hair back behind her ear, she gives you an apologetic smile. [lyssieth.speech(And I'm especially sorry to you, [pc.name]. I should have known that this day would come, and that I must choose to betray Lilith. You should not have had to endure the consequence of my indecision. Please, do stand up.)]

Doing as Lyssieth says, you push yourself up onto your [pc.feet]. Wanting now more than ever to get a real explanation of why you're here, and feeling the frustration of your seemingly never-ending quest to find out what's going on boiling over, you angrily state, [pc.speech(Look, I've been all over Dominion, trying to get someone to tell me why I'm in your world, and after finally finding Arthur, he tells me that you're the only one who has that information. Now, after running this way and that for goodness knows how long, I finally get to meet you, and then I get assaulted! What's more, you're talking about handing me over to Lilith, then something about humans suffering, and now you say you've decided to 'betray' your mother?! #IF pc.isSelfish() #THEN Don't keep us in suspense, Lyssieth, this has been a complete fucking nightmare! Just tell us what the fuck is going on! #ELSE Please, just tell me what's going on! #ENDIF)]

[lyssieth.speech(Don't worry, I'll tell you everything,)] [lyssieth.name] says, [lyssieth.speech(but first, let us conclude the business regarding my daughter's return. You have something to say, don't you, [siren.name]?)]

#IF siren.getAffection(pc)>30 #THEN [siren.speech(Y-Yes, I suppose...)] [siren.name] says, blushing and looking at the floor. [siren.speech(Sorry for all the trouble I caused. And thank you... F-For saving me, that is...)] #ELSE [siren.speech(Even though [pc.she] was going to leave me to be crushed? You're making me apologise?)] [siren.name] protests, but her mother just raises an eyebrow and starts tapping her foot on the floor. [siren.speech(Fine... Sorry, [pc.name], for all the trouble I caused...)] #ENDIF

[lyssieth.speech(Good girl. Now that we've got all of that out of the way, I think the three of us should pay my dear Lilaya a visit,)] Lyssieth says, [lyssieth.speech(It'll be best if I explain the situation to all of you at once.)]

[siren.speech(But getting to her place will take ages,)] [siren.name] complains.

[lyssieth.speech(Oh, we're not walking,)] [lyssieth.name] replies, [lyssieth.speech(I'll be teleporting the three of us there. I can disable mother's detection spells for a short while, so she shouldn't notice my absence. Now, come close, you two.)]

Lyssieth spreads her arms, and beckons you and [siren.name] to approach. It doesn't look like there's any other option but to do as you're told, and so you do as the elder lilin asks.

[pc.speech(Ok, let's go,)] you say, [pc.speech(I can't wait to get to the bottom of all this.)]

Doing as you're asked, you and [siren.name] step forwards to either side of Lyssieth, who quickly reaches out and pulls each of you into a one-armed hug. As you and her daughter are pressed in against her huge breasts, the elder lilin lets out a soft laugh, [lyssieth.speech(This feels cozy! Now, let me just disable mother's spells... And... Let's go!)]

With a sudden, blinding flash of purple light, the three of you vanish from Lyssieth's office...

In an instant, you, [siren.name], and Lyssieth are all standing in Lilaya's laboratory. On the other side of the room, Lilaya and Arthur are bending down over one of the many lab tables, with Rose hovering off to one side. All three of them have their backs to you, and as Lyssieth loosens her grip on you and her daughter, you realise that the trio in front of you have not noticed your sudden appearance.

[lilaya.speech(You're absolutely hopeless, you know that, right?)] Lilaya angrily scowls at Arthur, [lilaya.speech(I simply do not understand why you've never taken the time nor effort to wield the arcane yourself! Not only do you have to rely on me to do these experiments of yours, but you have the audacity to insinuate that it was my fault it didn't work!)]

[arthur.speech(Please, Lilaya, I wasn't saying tha-)] Arthur tries to explain, but your angry aunt cuts him off.

[lilaya.speech(And now you're lying about it! Just like you lied when you promised not to see anyone behind my back! The next thing I know, you'll be off fucking my mother again!)]

[lyssieth.speech(Lilaya! Stop that!)] Lyssieth interrupts, striding forwards as the three startled occupants of the lab spin around to face her. [lyssieth.speech(You can't take your anger out on Arthur like that!)]

[lilaya.speech(M-Mommy?!)] Lilaya exclaims, [lilaya.speech(What are you doing here?! And with [pc.name] and [siren.name] as well!)]

[siren.speech(Hi sis'!)] [siren.name] calls out, beaming fondly at Lilaya, and getting a warm smile in return.

[lyssieth.speech(We have some important things to discuss,)] Lyssieth says, cutting the sisters' reunion short, [lyssieth.speech(Honestly, Lilaya, you should have immediately told me about [pc.name] and all this business about finding out what's going on. It would have saved you all a lot of trouble.)]

[lilaya.speech(Excuse me?)] Lilaya replies in a sharp tone, [lilaya.speech(You think I'd ask for your help after what you did with Arthur? When you knew I was seeing him? And then you lock yourself away in Submission and refuse to even come and apologise?!)]

[lyssieth.speech(That wasn't out of choice,)] Lyssieth explains, [lyssieth.speech(When Lilith found out that I'd been with another human, she had me placed under house arrest. She thinks that I'm too fond of humans, and that I'll betray her and take their side. I can fool her detection spells long enough for a brief visit, such as this, but I couldn't get the time to come and apologise to you properly. You know I'm sorry for what I did...)]

[lilaya.speech(Under house arrest? Nobody told me...)] Lilaya pouts, before placing her hands on her hips and continuing, [lilaya.speech(Anyway, if your time is limited, we can resolve this later. Just tell me that I'm right, and that [pc.name] came from another dimension, and then we can talk about how to get [pc.herHim] back.)]

Lyssieth's expression hardens as she hears what her daughter has to say, before turning to Rose and scowling, [lyssieth.speech(First, get that slut out of here. What I have to say doesn't concern her.)]

[lilaya.speech(Don't talk about Rose like that!)] Lilaya shouts, stepping forwards to shield her maid from her mother.

[rose.speech(Please, Mistress, if you'll excuse me!)] Rose quickly interjects, before rushing over to the door and making her exit.

[lilaya.speech(You're unbelievable... Rose never did anything to you!)] Lilaya exclaims, shaking her head at Lyssieth, before letting out a weary sigh and dismissively waving her hand. [lilaya.speech(So go on then, tell us how to send [pc.name] back, and I'd also like to know why Lilith considers humans to be a threat. I mean, why else would she be concerned about you 'betraying' her for them?)]

[lyssieth.speech(Very well, but first, as it was he who requested my assistance, I'd like to hear Arthur's theory,)] Lyssieth says, looking over at her one-time lover.

[arthur.speech(Oh, erm, well, you see, I thought it highly unusual that Lilaya and I had such similar names and appearances as the versions of us that [pc.name] knew in [pc.her] world, so, instead of trying to investigate [pc.herHim], I decided to look a little closer at our own auras,)] Arthur starts, fidgeting a little in discomfort as you and the three succubi listen to his theory. [arthur.speech(Although I initially couldn't find anything unusual, I realised that the current methodology we have for examining auras was a little inadequate, so I devised a new method to detect any, erm, 'oddities' in a person's aura. By competitively hybridising my own aura with a reference sample of an arcane essence I had extracted from myself earlier, I was able to isolate and identify inconsistencies in auratic harmony, which, as earlier rese-)]

[lilaya.speech(Arthur, just get to the point already!)] Lilaya snaps, clearly not having the patience for his long-winded explanation.

[arthur.speech(Oh, right, yes, erm, well, that is to say, using a new method, I was able to detect a complex network of... Well, it sounds impossible, and this is why I needed to talk with Lyssieth, but this network that I discovered almost looks as though it's a shadow of past memories...)] Arthur says, stumbling over his words more than usual as he tries to explain his discovery. [arthur.speech(Now, these 'shadow memories' are far too faint and fleeting to actually decipher, but their presence alone suggests... well... that Lilaya and I were once different people... I believe that not only [pc.name] was transported to this world, but so too were Lilaya and I. Why we were transformed, and [pc.she] wasn't, however, I have no idea...)]

[lilaya.speech(How absolutely absurd!)] Lilaya laughs, [lilaya.speech(It seems as though all of your nonsensical research has finally fried your brain! Although I may not look it, both you and I have lived in this world for over forty years. How on earth could we have been transported here along with [pc.name]?!)]

Although Lilaya is quick to pour scorn on Arthur's theory, her mother lets out a soft laugh, before asking, [lyssieth.speech(So, you found a way to detect the memories of past lives? I doubt even Lilith knows how to do that...)]

[lilaya.speech(W-What?)] Lilaya asks, turning to face her mother, [lilaya.speech(Y-You mean there's some truth to what Arthur's saying?!)]

[lyssieth.speech(Some truth, yes,)] Lyssieth says, [lyssieth.speech(those traces of memories Arthur has discovered are indeed those of the people [pc.name] once knew. The core essence, or 'soul', inside the two of you were once those of [pc.namePos] aunt, Lily, and of her research colleague, Arthur. You weren't transported into any new world, however, and there's no way to send [pc.name] back to [pc.hers]... You see, this is [pc.namePos] world.)]

[pc.speech(That's impossible,)] you say, [pc.speech(I think I would have remembered there being a city full of demons and magic. There's absolutely no way this is my world.)]

[lilaya.speech(Exactly! It's impossible! How could you account for the fact that you gave birth to me over forty years ago, if this is [pc.namePos] world?!)] Lilaya exclaims, [lilaya.speech(I have memories of living in Dominion all my life!)]

[lyssieth.speech(Of course you do,)] Lyssieth says, trying to reassure her daughter with a warm smile. [lyssieth.speech(Although this is [pc.namePos] world, the reality of what it used to be was rewritten by a powerful spell which my mother cast. I need to explain from the beginning...)]

[siren.speech(Yes, please do,)] [siren.name] says, [siren.speech(I'm a little lost here.)]

[lyssieth.speech(Well, to go right back to the very start, my six sisters and I were born of Lilith and an unknown father over six thousand years ago.
